title: Your Ultimate Destination for Music and Podcasts
text:
As a music enthusiast and avid podcast listener, I can confidently say that Spotify has revolutionized the way I enjoy audio content. From its vast library of songs spanning every genre imaginable to its extensive collection of podcasts covering a diverse range of topics, Spotify truly stands out as the ultimate destination for all things audio.

One of the standout features of Spotify is its user-friendly interface, which allows for seamless navigation and discovery of new music and podcasts. Whether I'm searching for a specific artist or exploring curated playlists and recommendations, I always find myself effortlessly immersed in a world of endless entertainment options.

Another aspect that sets Spotify apart is its personalized recommendations and playlists. Through advanced algorithms that analyze my listening habits, Spotify consistently delivers tailored suggestions that align perfectly with my tastes. This level of customization ensures that I'm always discovering new music and podcasts that resonate with me on a personal level.

Furthermore, Spotify's commitment to supporting artists and creators is commendable. With features like Spotify for Artists and tools for podcasters, the platform empowers creators to share their work with a global audience and connect with fans in meaningful ways. As a listener, knowing that my support directly contributes to the success of talented musicians and podcasters adds an extra layer of satisfaction to my experience.

In addition to its impressive content library and user-friendly interface, Spotify offers a range of premium features that enhance the overall listening experience. From ad-free listening and offline downloads to high-quality audio streaming, Spotify Premium provides unparalleled convenience and quality for subscribers.

Overall, Spotify has earned my unwavering loyalty as the go-to platform for all my audio needs. With its vast selection, personalized recommendations, and commitment to supporting artists and creators, Spotify continues to exceed my expectations and enrich my listening experience with every song and podcast episode. Whether you're a music lover, podcast enthusiast, or both, Spotify is sure to become your ultimate companion for endless entertainment.

title: Unreliable Service
text:
Unfortunately the past few weeks, the app will constantly crash and close itself, even after deleting, redownloading, restarting, etc. There are no updates to install. 

Spotify also took down one of my favorite podcasts with no warning and wouldn’t tell them why until a bunch of angry people started calling them out on social media. Then the podcast was put back up, and they were never told why it was taken down. A multi-year catalog of episodes was gone and they never accepted responsibility. Some episodes are still missing, but no copyright issue was ever revealed or any other answer. 

Very disappointing how they also keep rearranging the Home Screen, changing the way the queues work, etc. 

I use it because it’s cheap, not because it’s good.

title: Audiobooks
text: I love Spotify and have had premium for years. Now audiobooks are available. I love that BUT the allotment for only the admin user is 15 hours a month. Couldn't you give us 2 books a month and advertise it that way? You'd probably duck in tons of Audible users because you $15 a month they only get one book. If you have 2 books plus music, such a better deal!

title: No more “Weatherman”?
text:
Used to love Spotify but the new features they’re making are so dumb. Like the song psychic and dj? They’re dumb. They keep recommending the same songs over and over in every playlist and daylist and smart shuffle.  The reason I was compelled to write this review after having and paying for the app for nearly 10 years is that I found out they removed “Weatherman” by Hank Williams Jr. 
Why am I paying for the app if they’re going to remove the songs I have the app for to listen to? I’m about ready to cancel the subscription and use a different platform.
